017package org.apache.commons.codec.binary;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Operations on {@link CharSequence} that are {@code null} safe.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * Copied from Apache Commons Lang r1586295 on April 10, 2014 (day of 3.3.2 release).
025 * </p>
026 *
027 * @see CharSequence
028 * @since 1.10
029 */
030public class CharSequenceUtils {
031
032    /**
033     * Green implementation of regionMatches.
034     *
035     * <p>
036     * Note: This function differs from the current implementation in Apache Commons Lang
037     * where the input indices are not valid. It is only used within this package.
038     * </p>
039     *
040     * @param cs
041     *            the {@code CharSequence} to be processed
042     * @param ignoreCase
043     *            whether or not to be case-insensitive
044     * @param thisStart
045     *            the index to start on the {@code cs} CharSequence
046     * @param substring
047     *            the {@code CharSequence} to be looked for
048     * @param start
049     *            the index to start on the {@code substring} CharSequence
050     * @param length
051     *            character length of the region
052     * @return whether the region matched
053     */
054    static boolean regionMatches(final CharSequence cs, final boolean ignoreCase, final int thisStart,
055            final CharSequence substring, final int start, final int length) {
056        if (cs instanceof String && substring instanceof String) {
057            return ((String) cs).regionMatches(ignoreCase, thisStart, (String) substring, start, length);
058        }
059        int index1 = thisStart;
060        int index2 = start;
061        int tmpLen = length;
062        while (tmpLen-- > 0) {
063            final char c1 = cs.charAt(index1++);
064            final char c2 = substring.charAt(index2++);
065            if (c1 == c2) {
066                continue;
067            }
068            if (!ignoreCase) {
069                return false;
070            }
071            // The same check as in String.regionMatches():
072            if (Character.toUpperCase(c1) != Character.toUpperCase(c2) &&
073                    Character.toLowerCase(c1) != Character.toLowerCase(c2)) {
074                return false;
075            }
076        }
077        return true;
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Consider private.
082     *
083     * @deprecated Will be private in the next major version.
084     */
085    @Deprecated
086    public CharSequenceUtils() {
087        // empty
088    }
089}
